snippet: The Chinese assistance, on a scale the United States never offered in the past decade of a close relationship with Pakistan, is likely to confirm the decline of American influence in that nation.
abstract: Chinese Pres Xi Jinping is traveling to Pakistan to sign accords for $46 billion worth of infrastructure and energy assistance; first overseas trip of the year for Xi comes in wake of warm reception in region for China-led Asia Infrastructure Investment Bank; move is meant to advance view of China as ascendant regional power, and to prevent spread of militant groups from Pakistan into western China.
lead_paragraph: The Chinese assistance, on a scale the United States never offered in the past decade of a close relationship with Pakistan, is likely to confirm the decline of American influence in that nation.

headline.main: Xi Jinping Heads to Pakistan, Bearing Billions in Infrastructure Aid
headline.print_headline: Xi Jinping Heads to Pakistan, Bearing Billions in Infrastructure Aid
